newsitem.title: USA: UBS says initiates three tech stocks.
newsitem.headline: UBS says initiates three tech stocks.

text.p: UBS Securities analyst Joseph Farley said he initiated coverage of Red Brick Systems Inc, Prism Solutions and Arbor Software Corp with hold ratings.
In research notes, he said that Red Brick's advantages over its competition were reflected in its current valuation.
He said that while Prism "plays in one of the hottest spaces in the warehousing market we have never been convinced of its ability to move beyond the niche role of tactical vendor."
Farley said of Arbor that "at valuations around 20 times trailing revenues, we think the shares could be exposed beyond our comfort level to the vagaries of the marketplace."
Red Brick was unchanged at 24, Prism was up 1/4 at 15-3/4 and Arbor fell 7/16 to 40-1/16.
